Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems a bad idea to have the centralized site doing unlimited onboard/offboarding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not to mention big problems of available capital

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: onboarding is currently designed to be able to scale on a self-sustaining basis

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its purpose is onboard and rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: adding the burden to it to solve the as of yet unsolved central banking problem... seems a real FTL drive might be easier

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the market needs to provide the buyside

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I put a very far away floor, but with unlimited volume

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that at least gives a worst case and I expect the market to tighten above that, especially if mining costs are more

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
I'm 100% in favor of onboarding, because any short-term losses miners see from it are outweighed by the long-term benefits of what is to be done with the funds.
I'm not a fan of an instadump inverse of onboarding though.
